title: Joining a Group Conversation
situation: You walk into a gathering and see a small group already talking. You’d like to join but feel awkward.
question: What do you do?

choices.label: Hover nearby and hope someone invites you in.
choices.outcome: You may feel more invisible and self-conscious the longer you wait.
choices.insight: Waiting to be chosen reinforces the belief that you don’t have permission to participate.

choices.label: Walk up, make eye contact with one person, and say, “Hey, can I join you? What are you all talking about?”
choices.outcome: Most groups open the circle slightly and include you naturally.
choices.insight: Simple, direct bids for inclusion often land better than the elaborate strategies we imagine.

choices.label: Leave the room and stay on your phone instead.
choices.outcome: You feel safer short term but miss a chance to practice low-stakes social courage.
choices.insight: Avoidance keeps anxiety comfortable but also keeps it in charge.
